title: Can teenage boys genuinely fall in love? - Quora

I think you're confused. See as we age we don't just magically form an ability to love overnight. You start by loving your mother. She is the human you will love more than any other. So you developed that love, what next? Maybe a T.V. show? At that moment your mind is telling you that you cannot live without that T.V. show. You need it to be happy! Then, you develop a love for baseball. If you never played baseball again, you know your life wouldn't be worth living. You need baseball! I can go on, but I think you understand. What defines love? Adults say we don't know what love is even though it is the first emotion we feel. We have a bond with our mother from birth. We don't even know how to open and close our eyes yet and we already love our mother. Yes, teenagers can fall in love.

They can indeed fall in love. It's less common for it to be the same way as in movies, simply because said movies are unrealistic. Every relationship is different. Falling in love won't be the same experience for everyone, or even for the same person with different people. People show affection in different ways. Teenagers definitely do fall in love, although a lot of the time, what they think of as ‘love’ is actually infatuation - a short-lived attraction for someone that's so intense that they believe they're in love. That's not to say that they don't fall in love though - given enough time and patience, it's possible for a healthy relationship to become one of love. I should know.

Sure we can, why not? Thing is, falling in love with someone who has already fallen in love with you is a rare thing, unlike in movies. Sometimes his goal is sex, sometimes he kissed you because you seemed interesting enough and wanted to have time to see whether he’ll fall in love, sometimes it’s for the status, etc. The only difference is that teenagers are usually more horny than general population and they are more easily pressured by the society into having a relationship with someone (anyone, or a particular persion). So it might be rarer, though not proven, but it certainly exists.

Of course, boys can be more without feelings(fellings that we show, but inside us we can fell, can be a small feeling, but fell). Normally girls show more we they are “in love”, but boys fall in love too, sometimes tell this loves to close-friends(friends that the boy know that he don’t will make gossip). When we’re teens can be more difficult to separe sexual atrattion to a true love, but can be a real and genuinely love. Sometimes girls can be a challenge for we and will make a confusing in our minds, will let us a silly but will be the one of the best challenges of our lifes. PS: I’m not in love, only wrote with my heart.
